page.title: 02STIRCHLEY GRANGE HISTORY
page.content: {STIRCHLEY GRANGE}is probably the oldest house in our area.Parts of it are 300 years old,but there has been a dwelling there for about 700 years.It was given to the monks of{Buildwas {Abbey}by{Osbert of Stirchley}who farmed it until the dissolution of the monasteries by{Henry VIII.}It forms an important part of our{LOCAL HISTORY, as subsequent owners were involved in the{Gunpowder Plot,}and one of them, {Francis Throckmorton,}was beheaded for plotting against{Elizabeth I.}The estate was bought and sold several times and because of the unique area it is situated in,the owners had local business interests in iron and coal mining. It is close to the{IRONBRIDGE {GORGE}which was the birthplace of the {INDUSTRIAL REVOLUTION.}In 1964 it was bought by{Dawley New Town}for use as a tree and shrub nursery.
